title: Migrate Document Templates into QMS Control

comment:
NON-COMPLIANT: Missing execution items for QMS CLI modification.

FINDINGS:

1. QMS CLI Does Not Support TEMPLATE Document Type
   The DOCUMENT_TYPES configuration in .claude/qms.py (lines 71-83) does not include TEMPLATE. Execution items EI-2 through EI-8 and EI-10 cannot succeed without CLI support.

2. Missing Execution Items
   - No EI for adding TEMPLATE to DOCUMENT_TYPES in qms.py
   - No EI for updating get_doc_type() function to recognize TEMPLATE-* pattern
   - SOP-001 update listed as 'Potential Update' but no corresponding EI

3. Execution Sequence Defect
   The QMS CLI must be modified BEFORE template migration can occur (EI-2 through EI-8).

REQUIRED CORRECTIONS:

1. Add execution item to update qms.py DOCUMENT_TYPES configuration with TEMPLATE type specification (path, executable, prefix settings)

2. Add execution item to update get_doc_type() function to recognize TEMPLATE-* document IDs

3. Sequence these new EIs before the migration EIs (current EI-2 through EI-8)

4. Clarify whether SOP-001 Section 2 (Scope) and Section 6.1 (Naming Convention) require updates to include TEMPLATE - if yes, add corresponding EI

5. Verify CR impact assessment reflects the qms.py file modification

COMPLIANCE REVIEW COMPLETE. Verified: (1) Frontmatter: title='Migrate Document Templates into QMS Control', revision_summary='v0.2: Added QMS CLI extension for dynamic document types'. (2) All 12 required sections per SOP-002 Section 6 are present. (3) Previous deficiencies addressed: EI-1 through EI-3 add CLI support for TEMPLATE type BEFORE migration tasks (EI-4+); Impact Assessment Section 7.1 includes qms_schema.py and qms.py; SOP-001 update marked 'Required' in Section 7.2. (4) No TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX placeholders found. Execution placeholders are appropriate for pre-approval stage. Document is COMPLIANT with procedural requirements.

NON-COMPLIANT: Post-execution review identifies the following deficiency that must be corrected before approval:

**DEFICIENCY: revision_summary does not conform to required format**

OBSERVED: revision_summary: 'v0.2: Added QMS CLI extension for dynamic document types'
REQUIRED: Must begin with CR ID per SOP-002 Section 8 (e.g., 'CR-017: ...')

**EXECUTION VERIFICATION (all items verified):**

EI-1: VERIFIED - qms_schema.py line 13 contains TEMPLATE in DOC_TYPES; line 54 contains TEMPLATE pattern
EI-2: VERIFIED - qms.py line 84 contains TEMPLATE configuration
EI-3: VERIFIED per execution summary (testing performed)
EI-4: VERIFIED - QMS/TEMPLATE/, QMS/.meta/TEMPLATE/, QMS/.audit/TEMPLATE/ exist
EI-5 through EI-11: VERIFIED - All 7 templates EFFECTIVE v1.0
EI-12: VERIFIED - .claude/workshop/templates/ no longer exists
EI-13: VERIFIED - SOP-001 v13.0 EFFECTIVE with TEMPLATE in Section 6.1 naming table (line 248), revision_summary properly references CR-017
EI-14: VERIFIED per execution summary (CLI verification performed)

All execution items completed correctly. The only deficiency is the CR frontmatter itself.

REQUIRED ACTION: Update CR-017 frontmatter revision_summary to begin with 'CR-017:' then re-route for post-review.

COMPLIANCE REVIEW - CR-017 Re-submission. Verified frontmatter: title='Migrate Document Templates into QMS Control', revision_summary='CR-017: Migrate document templates into QMS control with CLI extension' (correctly begins with CR ID). All 12 required sections present. No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME) found. No typos or formatting errors. All 14 execution items documented with Pass outcomes. Prior deficiency (revision_summary format) has been corrected. Document is COMPLIANT. Recommend approval.
